caption: Went to one of the Chef Tasting events as they are slowly reopening after the long shutdown. Everything was very good! Service was attentive but not hovering. The courses were interesting without scaring less adventurous eaters. The details in preparation and presentation are evident in every ingredient.

Food here is great and if you have allergies they are very accommodating. The staff is friendly, and I have yet to find a cocktail that the bartender's cannot make. Overall fantastic experience everytime I go.
Great food, great service, awesome atmosphere
Such a cool place! And yummy food.
Delicious! We went for the Valentine's day experience- worth every penny!

Overall experience was amazing! Very beautiful hole in the wall kind of place! We went for a friend's birthday celebration! Would have never known it was there! Loved the cool way to get in! Food was amazing! Heads up! Don't order as many appetizers as us! We got full before our meals even came! Overall i loved it! Highly recommend for a date night really cool experience!!!

I love this place!  Great atmosphere. Delicious food. Good service.  I've done a late à la carte option and the "experience".  First, this is upscale.  If you want a cheap meal, this is not your place.  This is quality food prepared expertly. The experience is only $35. I've seen restaurants offer a similar experience for $50+.  The cocktails are amazing.  They are about $10 each but I feel that is very on par for the quality and compared to other upscale restaurants.  The charcuterie board is generous.  The sexy butter is a must try.  This is a perfect place for a romantic dinner, a special occasion or if you just feel like splurging. I look forward to coming back soon.
Great food and drinks.  A really cool atmosphere, it was fun to do "the experience" at least one time.
Cocktails are too sweet, but the food is decent. Whatever you do, don't order the NY strip. They slice it and put some sort of teriyaki sauce on it. It's tremendously disappointing.

Cool, quirky place. Interesting concept, great drinks. The kitchen seemed to be overwhelmed, some of the dishes not up to standard. Had to wait almost an hour for food with no bread or anything tide us over. Will try again on a slower night.
Loved going at 9pm. More chill. They still have a food menu at the bar and it's great!
What an amazing place! The food was incredible and the atmosphere was really unique.

I order poutine last night that had a flavor very unlike the poutine I ate there when they first opened. The waitress took the dish back to the kitchen and the host returned with it saying they refreshed my gravy which was omitted originally. After tasting it the full flavor of the dish I ate on my first visit there was realized. Why couldn't they just say they forgot the gravy? The  great chocolate tart dessert somewhat alleviated the poutine situation.

Stopping through Bloomington on our way back from Chicago the folks at the Vrooman Mansion recommended this place for good, farm-to-table food - and the experience was amazing. The atmosphere was perfect. A restaurant meets speak-easy, with the perfect ambiance. The cocktails were stellar, and the food was just delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant, and I hope we make it back in the future.

Food is  5 star and worth the visit.  Part of the ambiance is live music.  However be sure to call ahead as it is random wether or not they will have any. Our Friday night did not.  Also, with the small seating area and close to the bar, it can get noisy fast. Overall, go and try this unique dining experience.
Easily best restaurant in Bloomington-Normal area. Menu is always changing, but food is always delicious!
I've never been disappointed with the creativity of the menu selections and the service! I highly encourage this dining experience!
Spectacular food and experience.  Staff us amazing and very descriptive
Great place, Great service. Interesting food
One of the best restaurants in town. Creative menu and outstanding service
Great food. Great drinks! Very cool atmosphere.
Great food and the atmosphere is very neat (and I've really seen nothing like it before).

This place was as reviewed by so many others.  Food and service was spot on as are the rest of the brands in this family of restaurants.  We've eaten at all 4.  This one is a fun experience.  Drinks made the bill add up, but it was with it.  Make a reservation and go for it.  Menu is changing today, so if you have been before the menu will be different.  Portions size was good to share.  I will be back.
Chewy 10 out of 10 stars.
Must Visit
Very expensive, but a fun experience for special occasions.
A hidden gem that provides interesting food with top notch service. Highly recommended.

Dinner was delicious, and the ambiance was unlike anything else we have in Bloomington-Normal. The attention to detail on the plate really made this stand above anything else we have in town. Every thing was seasoned really well, and served fresh. We will definitely be back!
Incredible. Incredible food. Incredible service
The best staff! Food is outrageously delicious! The "Experience" is awesome!

We had a reservation for dinner,  but there was a long wait. Bar drinks are good, but pricey. The same for the food. Much of their items are plates to share, and they are good. However, because of their prices, I doubt that I will come here often.
Great food and service.
Great atmosphere but pricey, & limited food menu.
Great experience! A must try in town
Food, drinks, service and atmosphere were all amazing!!!

We had such a great time at Bakery and Pickle celebrating a friends birthday and enjoyed lots of laughs. Our waiter, Spencer, went above and beyond, and joined in and participated in our jokes and gave us lots of laughs too. We will be back.
What a great and unique place for Blono.  We had a great meal.
So cool! Definitely worth checking out!
This place is so special. The food is wonderful, ambiance is cool, and drinks are great!
Food preparation like I've never experienced in Bloomington/Normal.  Every component on the plate creates the perfect bite.  Unfortunately no pics, too busy enjoying. $$$$

An amazing experience. Service was exceptional. Food was exceptional. Past reviewers said it took them 3 hours. We had a reservation at 6 and left at 7:30. Great meal, great service. And they did a little extra for my birthday which was special. Pricey but fantastic! Well worth the money

Deliciously AMAZING! The bartender understands the minute details of the spirits they serve and is happy to substitute spirits of your liking to make a fabulous cocktail. The staff is knowledgeable of the food served and how it is prepared. It is a delightful experience everytime we go here.   The atmosphere...well come experience it for yourself, you will NOT be disappointed!
One of the few places I would rate this high. Never had a bad experience. Great food and atmosphere.

Not really impressed. Great concept, poor execution. I was literally hit by a wall while waiting to be seated, because no one informed me I may get hit by a swinging wall where I was standing. I was on a date and we were seated at the family table, which is the first thing you see when you walk through the wall-door, not the most romantic location. The dining area to the left when waking in, I think would have been much more intimate. I made late night reservations, because I was confused as to how the earlier "experience" even works. I was under the impression it was a family style meal to be shared with other patrons, but have come to find this is not the case. The late night menu is incredibly limited. I ordered "Parmesan Truffle fries" and a signature cocktail whose name I cannot recall, both were lackluster and tasteless. My partner's burger tasted like a literal farm, cow patties and all. The best tasting thing of the evening was the slice of heirloom tomato on the burger that no chef can take credit for. The smoke from whatever was happening in the kitchen was so intense that I had makeup all around my eyes by the time I left from tearing. And please do not get me started on the music-- I felt like I was in purgatory with this obnoxious, insanely loud and repetitive piano music over the speakers. I gave two stars for the concept and decor including the ladies room which is selfie perfect. I would have liked to gone back for the “experience”, but given the smoke, music, and lack of consideration for a couple (who had reservations) I can't say I will be back soon.
Amazing!
Great food. Great service. Awesome atmosphere

The experience, and food is amazing. What makes me sad are the portion sixes. One chicken breast is meant to be shared between two people. There were 4 of us and the steak option on the predestined menu was sold out. Our wine choice was not available either. Dinner, with drinks, was $417. I was nearly knocked out when a cow bell fell from the decorative hidden door, and yet we continued our dining “experience” without a mention of this. The atmosphere and food was amazing, and no one left hungry. All and all a fun dinner with family from out of town.

The food was all delicious! But be prepared that this will be your whole evening. It's also more expensive than we normally have, but as long as you are aware up front, very enjoyable! We dressed up and had lots of fun! The family style sides were delicious and fun to share. We had a group of 7. The piano player was quite good, but the music they put on while he was on break was horrible.

Let me start off by saying the food is absolutely amazing. The drinks were very good. Overall quality of the meal was outstanding, but our experience with the person waiting on us was miserable and makes me never want to come back.  We came for "the experience" which is a multi course meal. The food was great. At the time of this review, it is not mentioned anywhere that this is considered a 3 hour endeavor. Had we known that coming in, that would be fine. We unknowingly walked into a 3 hour dinner, which was actually 3 hours and 45 minutes including wait time, despite having reservation made well in advance.  Our waiter was informative about the plates, but was condescending when we were curious about our wait. We were sat, had the appetizer, waited 75 minutes, had the main course, waited 75 minutes, etc...  We were lied to several times about our food. We were routinely told its being plated right now, to just wait more. And more. One party in our group had to leave early, because they weren't expecting the wait. They were then told, very condescendingly, that if they didn't want to wait the 3 hours through "the experience" then they shouldn't have gotten "the experience." which again, at the time of this writing, is not stated anywhere on the menu, website, or anywhere that I have looked. When we left, we were told that they mixed up the checks, and the party that left got the wrong check, so we were told we had to make up the difference. We were also blamed for the time it took to serve our food. One person had a nut allergy, and one of the desert plates had pistachios on it. We were told our deserts were plated and ready, then half hour later we were told they were redoing the desert since they put pistachios on it, then a half hour later we got a desert plate that had... Wait for it.... Pistachios on it.  I really wanted to believe that the person waiting on us was horrible and ruined my impression, but I'm not willing to take the gamble on my time and money to try again.

Absolutely incredible place to share a meal experience with friends and family.  For the full service, I would not consider it just a place to get a meal, it really is more of an "experience". Some people might appreciate that more than others. For those who just want to have a small bite and a few drinks, that seems to be the best thing to do in the bar area.  For the full dinner service, once you get over the fact that this isn't going to be your typical restaurant and understand that you're going to need to keep an open mind going into it, you can really appreciate what they've done here.  Epiphany Farms's restaurants are the most competent, well-rounded restaurants we have in this area, and Bloomington-Normal is better for it.  My wife took me here for my birthday and we chose the NY Strip Steak for the 2nd course, and ...wow, easily cut that thing with a fork and it was cooked perfectly med-rare. The level of attention to detail here far surpasses the previous standard in BloNo. I'm looking forward to to going back

A true SpeakEasy, with a texted password or email needed to get into this establishment. Another expression from the Epiphany Farms ownership, and a great addition to their lineup. Having drinks at the bar, or having a great meal are both available.
Another great expression of the Epiphany Farms ownership. A SpeakEasy that has great cocktails and a wonderful daily menu. Getting in can be tricky. A text message needed

Excellent atmosphere. Loved most everything I ate. Fun prohibition era cocktails. But make sure to set aside several hours for "the experience" menu - our reservation for a group of 8 on a busy Saturday was for 7:30p, we were seated at 8:15, we finished all the courses around 10:30, paid and left by 11. Overall I'd recommend!
great atmosphere, good food, unique drink selection.
Excellent food and experience. Definitely one of a kind in Bloomington. Great for a special night out and you won't be rushed.

Myself and a couple other friends from Chicago visited this restaurant during homecoming weekend and had a really good time. I knew what to expect going in thanks to my insider connections and thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere. The design of the restaurant definitely captures that speakeasy vibe and the attention to detail was well executed. Didn’t experience the piano player upon visiting but had good music on the speakers that captured that speakeasy vibe as well. I would reccommend having some sort of speakeasy band play late at night to really capture the spirit of the 20’s.  One thing to keep in mind.... it’s going to be expensive. College students beware! Unless you stick to appetizers. My pork flatbread was incredible and the cocktails were creative and delicious and worth the price. I could tell some time and effort were made to make the drink menu and as someone who makes their own cocktails I was very impressed.  The only negative was that my flatbread took almost 25 min to get to our table but overall had an amazing time and plan to come back again.

Wow! What wonderful ambience with historical flair. They even have live piano music playing the whole time! They provide the perfect amount of attention and friendliness in their service and the food is delicious! I enjoyed eating foods and drinks in unexpected combinations and preparations. They also tell you about everything they are serving from what it is to how it's prepared and from where it came. The food is prepared for groups of two to share. Be prepared to pay at least $100 or more for two people if you get drinks and any add-ons. I recommend The Bee's Knees and the pickle bowl for a drink and extra. The whole experience is definitely worth every penny!

The coolest place in town, period. The prix fixe menu blew everyone at the table away in both presentation and taste, accompanied with excellent service. The late-night menu has something for everyone, but no matter when you go, the drinks and ambiance will be on point.
So much fun!!!  The food is amazing as well as the service and attention to detail.  We loved the speakeasy decor.  An evening at Bakery And Pickle is truly an experience!!

My wife and I enjoyed our visit but they have a policy which probably will keep us from returning. Both have to order the same entre. Takes me back to when the only way you use to be able to order Chateaubriand.

I can't rave enough about this place. It's fantastic.  First off, the negative, it's expensive...quite. For 2 people and drinks you're easily going to clear 100$.  Now, with that said, it's worth every penny. The food is absolutely phenomenal. It's as good as ANY high end restaurant I've been in anywhere (including Chicago, New Orleans, California, I'm an amateur foody I guess). The menu is adventurous and it pays off. Even dishes I wouldn't think I'd like are excellent. For instance, radishes, I abhor radishes...they not only made them palatable, but very very good.  I can't rate the food highly enough.  The other thing is the cocktails. Again, these aren't your standard bar fare drinks. They are clearly crafted with love, and it shows. Try something on the edge of your comfort zone and you will be pleasantly rewarded.  The real draw though is the atmosphere. They're going for a 1920's prohibition style speak easy. They nailed it. Everything from the hidden door entrance, to the piano player, to the drinks, to the overall look. It's all very well executed and something completely refreshing for this area.  The final word...try this place. I can't recommend it enough.

Our first experience with Bakery & Pickle was great! We tried a lot of the items on their menu and loved each one, and we really like that the menu itself is really curated and not overwhelming. The atmosphere is very cool—great concept, amazing decor, great lighting, and it is perfect for date night or after dinner drinks! They may have a few things to figure out regarding the “password”...but it’s only been open 2 weeks so I’m sure they will get that process nailed down soon.  LOVE that there is another local restaurant/bar in BN where we can enjoy an evening of good company and good drinks.

Great first experience. Went with the dinner experience which is 35$ per person excluding drinks. Beautiful speakeasy vibe and decor, fantastic and attentive service. Great food and plating as well. Their china is exquisite as well.
